intro: Faurea argentea, commonly known as silver tree or silverleaf tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Proteaceae. It is native to the coastal regions of South Africa, particularly in the Western Cape. The plant is characterized by its silver-gray foliage, which is covered in fine, dense hairs. It produces clusters of small, white, tubular flowers that bloom in spring. Faurea argentea is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is adapted to well-drained, sandy soils.
